Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two distinct habitats, one representing a land environment, such as a playground or forest, and the other depicting a water environment like a pond or stream.
The student can include various living things in the land habitat, such as trees, bushes, and animals like squirrels or ants, with most elements appearing correctly and clearly.
The student can illustrate a variety of living things in the water habitat, like fish and water plants, with generally accurate representation.
The student can compare the diversity of plants and animals in the two habitats by placing their drawings side-by-side, showing a reasonable variety without being exhaustive.
CANNOT: The student may have minor gaps in labeling all patterns observed in the types of living things in each habitat, possibly leaving some items unlabeled. (e.g., some species or elements may be left unnamed)

The student might inconsistently show the variety found in each habitat, perhaps missing a few expected living things or misplacing some within the drawing (e.g., placing a land animal in the water or vice versa).
